justifications: Other European countries had been less than enthusiastic to impose sanctions on the Kremlin.
Brexit might well provide changes for 'good potential for growth in the value of securities' that would benefit the Russian economy.
Was it the business of a US president to tell the British voter how to go about his or her business? No.
While Donald Trump has been dismissed as a lunatic on this subject, amongst others, his statements about the way Obama behaved on Britain's referendum were relevant.
There remains a conspicuous fear in the US Republic that civilization must be a centralising endeavour.
